keys.ore-base-block: The block that the ore appears in, and is the base of the ore texture.
keys.ore-mask: The image that determines the shape of the coloured parts of the ore and the vibrance of the colour in different pixels.
keys.refined-item-mask: The image that determines the shape of the refined item and the vibrance of the colour in different pixels.
keys.colour: The base colour of the ore and refined item. This will be the colour of the pixels in the textures where the mask colour is completely white.
keys.spawning-rules: The set of spawning rules the game will follow when generating this ore. The options are preexisting spawning rules for vanilla ores.
keys.dungeon-spawn -> end-city-spawn: The likelyhood of the game spawning the refined item in loot chests inside each generated structure.
keys.ore-drop: Does the ore drop the refined item or the ore block when mined?
keys.minimum-tool-level: The lowest harvesting level that a tool needs to be to harvest the ore.
keys.positive-status-effect: The positive status effect ID that is associated with this ore.
keys.negative-status-effect: The negative status effect ID that is associated with this ore.
keys.tool-craftable: Can the refined item be crafted into tools?
keys.helmet-craftable: Can the refined item be crafted into a helmet?
keys.chestplate-craftable: Can the refined item be crafted into a chestplate?
keys.leggings-craftable: Can the refined item be crafted into a leggings?
keys.boots-craftable: Can the refined item be crafted into a boots?
keys.block-craftable: Can the refined item be crafted into blocks?
keys.consumable-food: Can the refined item be consumed for food?
keys.consumable-status-effect: Can the refined item be consumed for a status effect? (this is always positive)
keys.food-value: The amount of food points that are given to the player after consuming the refined item.
keys.consumed-effect-duration: The duration of the status effect given to the player after consuming the refined item.
keys.tool-durability: The durability value of the tools made of this ore.
keys.tool-mine-speed: The mining speed for tools made of this ore.
keys.tool-harvesting-level: The harvesting level for tools made of this ore.
keys.attack-damage: The amount of damage these tools can do; this value corresponds to a set of vanilla tools, which are used for the values.
keys.damage-status-effect: Is a status effect applied to an entity when damaged with a sword made of this ore? (this is always negative)
keys.attack-effect-duration: The duration of the status effect given to an entity after being damaged with a sword made of this ore.
keys.helmet-durability -> boots-durability: The durability value of each armour piece.
keys.helmet-protection -> boots-protection: The amount of armour points each armour piece gives. A full armour bar is 20 points.
keys.armour-status-effect: Can the armour be worn for a status effect?
keys.refined-block-mask: The base texture for the refined block of this ore.
keys.refined-block-status-effect: Is a status effect given to an entity when it is standing on the block?
keys.refined-block-status-effect-type: Is the status effect given to an entity when it is standing on the block positive or negative?

options-by-key.dungeon-spawn -> end-city-spawn: 0 = none, 1 = very rare, 2 = rare, 3 = uncommon, 4 = common
options-by-key.damage-status-effect -> consume-status-e: Minecraft status effect ID for corresponding effect

options-by-value.[ARRAY]: The program chooses from the elements in the array in an equal probability distribution.
options-by-value.random-rgb: The program randomly picks 3 values from 0 to 255 inclusive which determine the R, G and B colour values of the colour.
options-by-value.[range-inclusive, A, B]: The program randomly picks a value from A to B inclusive.
